Package prng.seeds

This package provides storage for seed entropy.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DeferredSeed
    A seed whose data is only derived when it is actually needed.
    FileStorage
    Store all seed information in a single file and load it all into memory when needed.
    PreferenceStorage
    Store seed data in the JVM's system or user preferences storage.
    Seed
    Storable seed data.
    SeedInput
    Read previously stored data back from a byte array.
    SeedOutput
    Write data to a byte array, prior to saving it.
    SeedStorage
    Storage for PRNG seed information.
    SystemPrefsStorage
    Store seed data in the JVM's system preferences storage
    UserPrefsStorage
    Store seed data in the JVM's user preferences storage
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    StorageException
    A problem occurred with seed storage

Package prng.seeds Description

This package provides storage for seed entropy. Each stored seed has a unique name. The seed may contain any structured information, but a typical seed will just contain an entropy block. An entropy block is an opaque data block that represents information unknown to an opponent. The entropy block is passed through a one-way cipher on every save and every load. The cipher preserves the unknown information, but because the cipher key is unknown the actual bits used as a seed are also unknown. Examining the file neither before it is used nor after will reveal the actual bits used for the seed.
Author:
Simon Greatrix
